When Ivy walks into the doctor’s office, she should be focused on the care she needs, not worrying about whether someone is going to rip that peace of mind away from her because of a preexisting condition.

I know it’s exhausting for the 5.8M Americans who are battling this relentless disease. That’s why as Senator I’m fighting to find new ways to tackle Alzheimer’s Disease. As #AlzheimersAwarenessMonth comes to an end, we must continue to address this public health crisis. #ENDALZ pic.twitter.com/Y2B55ESiHB

#AlzheimersAwarenessMonth hits close to home for many families, including mine. When my grandmother Katherine was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s, my entire family was affected. We became her caregivers and her advocates, and watching her health decline was extremely difficult.
